projects.description: The project focuses on college student-athletes, preferably college freshmen, on how they cope with the demanding schedules they face everyday. My friend and I are investigating if the athletes go through a counseling program where they are engaged in many intervention sessions for the entire school year and have them fill out evaluations based on the stigma of seeking counseling, it will help reduce the feeling of being "less superior" or "heroic" among their peers which is what athletes are usually stigmatized for. They will have a better understanding about stigma placed on not only college athletes but athletes in general. This is a between-subjects design that is expected to take about two years to complete. Six Div. 1 teams will be recruited from a New York State university. All class years will be involved but we're only focusing on the results from the freshmen for both years. Year 1 will be given surveys every two weeks throughout the whole year asking about stigma on athletes, counseling etc. They will not receive counseling. Year 2 is a different group but will ask last year's freshmen to participate if possible. Same procedure as Year 1 except they will be in the counseling program. Three types of intervention sessions include self-disclosure, counseling education and team building exercises. These will be done every week and will vary every week. After which, surveys will be implemented when the sessions are done. Doing this research proposal, it can help us find out if this is effective on reducing their stigma and if they are more willing to seek counseling.
projects.title: Psychology Senior Seminar Research Proposal: An Evaluation of a Program to Reduce the Stigma of College Athletes Seeking Counseling

message.text:
This month’s Community of Practice  webinar will showcase the Smart Bioprocessing Grand Challenge. Learn how we can use digital technologies to transform bioprocess development to get medicines to large scale manufacture faster, cheaper and with robust processes.

"Digital Technologies in Bioprocess Development: Accelerating Medicines to Market" 

Sign up here https://lnkd.in/dduv-bk4 to hear from the Elaine Speirs and here team Lukas Kürten, Sean Ruane (CPI Healthcare) 

Owen Burbidge David Berry Laura Griffiths Mark Talford Joana da Silva Rachel Harris
We will be sharing some of the work from the CPI Smart Bioprocess Development proof of concept study. Please sign up to hear from our technical lead Sean Ruane and digital lead Lukas Kürten.

message.text:
Two really nice events coming your way as part of the #InnovateUK #TransformingMedicinesManufacturing #CommunityofPractice. 

1️⃣ 2nd May: online webinar to learn more about the Smart Bioprocessing Grand Challenge led by Elaine Speirs and colleagues. Hear about this unique approach to bioprocess modelling and the creation of product-agnostic insilico models and what this can mean for your business in terms of costs, productivity and net zero 

https://lnkd.in/dduv-bk4

2️⃣  14th May: online workshop focusing on new innovation and the UK landscape for intracellular drug delivery with Juliana Haggerty and colleagues

https://lnkd.in/dstiEXX9

Register for both today!

#BioProcessing #SmartBioprocessing #IntracellularDrugDelivery #NewTechnologies #TMMCOP

Owen Burbidge  Laura Griffiths  David Berry  Rachel Harris Joana da Silva

This is a great article. We are really only competing with ourselves, to continually learn and develop but thats an easy insight for me, near the end of my career. Positive, immediate and regular feedback  to those beside and below you can help build confidence.

When you compare your abilities to those around you, what assumptions are you making? 

If you’ve ever felt like an #imposter at work, I’d be willing to bet that it is, at least in part, because you have endlessly compared yourself to the best in your business. So, what can you do about such behaviour before it stunts your growth?

Read my 4-min article on managing social comparison here:

https://lnkd.in/eMu3pGpY
There are two engineering apprenticeships open at the CPI-led Medicines Manufacturing Innovation Centre in Glasgow. Please share this and help us find our newest members of staff.

ingestedContentSummary.description: CPI has an exciting opportunity for two Maintenance Technician Apprentices to join the Operational Engineering team in Glasgow
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: CPI has an exciting opportunity for two Maintenance Technician Apprentices to join the established and growing Operational Engineering team within the Medicines Manufacturing Innovation Centre based in Paisley, near Glasgow Airport. The Operational Engineering team deliver a broad range of engineering skills to assist with the delivery of commercial and collaborative R & D projects in the areas of pharmaceutical innovation. You will be part of a team providing technical expertise, capability and input contributing to the delivery of projects in the broad area of pharmaceutical innovation. You will work closely with the project teams to deliver new public and privately funded projects. You will have the opportunity to work at the interface of academia and industry, with a large number of projects, partners, technologies and market sectors. This variety will give you the opportunity to work on fundamental science/R & D as well as product development and commercialisation. You will gain hands on experience maintaining state of the art pharmaceutical equipment, cleanrooms and facility. This is a transformative role with your focus revolving around the challenges set by the Medicines Manufacturing Innovation Centre ( MMIC ) , propelling the delivery for ground-breaking GMP innovation projects. As an engineering apprentice you will be providing support to CPI assets whilst working under supervision on a range of activities to meet objectives and contribute to project work. Key tasks as an engineering apprentice will include (but are not limited to the below), please download the job description for full details
ingestedContentSummary.title: Engineering Apprentice | CPI

message.text: Fantastic opportunity to join CPI at the Medicines Manufacturing Innovation Centre working on some of the most cutting edge technology and with a friendly and welcoming team.

commentary.text: My high school maths teacher told me i would amount to nothing as i was from the poorer part of town. I earned my PhD in industrial microbiology looking as oxygen flow modelling. Thank you for teaching me that i deserved better and helping me become a mentor to young people. Her name doesn't deserve to be remembered! Thank you Mr Judge for helping me see i could become a scientist. We owe so much to all our teachers
Abby Clark Its the next chapter. I hope its great
From the first call i had with Abby Clark i said - That girl will go far. She is a very impressive young woman and i will watch with interest where her career goes

I have been incredibly lucky to be working for a very supportive organisation, CPI , during my diagnosis and recovery from cancer. I had support from occ health to structure my return to work, which help immensely as this was a new world for me but not them. They led me back to my new work life which only helped my recovery
A publicly funded company should have a minimum behavioural standard for employees. They have learned nothing from the past eg Jimmy Saville
Sara Spencer ATII TEPIts not incorporated into DNA. Its not gene therapy. Gene therapy is technically much more difficult than that
Sara Spencer ATII TEPIts not a gene therapy as its not got gene sequences which are incorporated into patient DNA or a vector to make that possible

Sara Spencer ATII TEP mRNA is very unstable in the body and does not persist, and it was triggering an antigen not a pathogen to be made, which gets the immune system to respond. An mRNA vaccine is in trial in multiple locations globally for breast cancer antigens and as I have breast cancer would be part of this trial if I could
Fiona Parker though you might find this interesting
Well done Abby. I hope our paths cross again
BOB CROMPTONAt Glasgow you cant get back out without paying.
